trucks.name: Category 5 Tanker
trucks.description: Light bushfire truck, often used in rough terrain

trucks.name: Bulk Water Tanker (BWT)
trucks.description: Large water-carrying truck for supporting operations

crews.name: Bushfire Firefighting Crew
crews.description: Specializes in controlling and extinguishing bushfires in rural areas.

crews.name: Bulk Water Tanker Crew
crews.description: Highly trained crew deployed to inaccessible bushfire areas, often via helicopter.

trucks.name: Village Fire Tanker
trucks.description: Designed for both bushfires and structural fires

crews.name: Village Firefighting Crew
crews.description: Handles both bushfires and structural fires in rural communities.

crews.name: Remote Area Firefighting Team (RAFT)
crews.description: Highly trained crew deployed to inaccessible bushfire areas, often via helicopter.

trucks.name: Category 9 Tanker
trucks.description: Very small, fast-response unit for tight areas

trucks.name: Aviation Support Vehicler
trucks.description: Supports aircraft operations in bushfire areas

crews.name: NSW Parks and Wildlife Service (NPWS) Fire Crews
crews.description: Protects national parks and conservation areas from bushfires.

crews.name: Remote Area Firefighting Team (RAFT)
crews.description: Highly trained crew deployed to inaccessible bushfire areas, often via helicopter.
